verbs.description: President Donald Trump [V: has] used national security to justify his tariffs against Canada . But he admitted on Twitter he is doing it for another reason , opening the door for a lawsuit .

[ARG0: President Donald Trump] has [V: used] [ARG1: national security] [ARG2: to justify his tariffs against Canada] . But he admitted on Twitter he is doing it for another reason , opening the door for a lawsuit .

[ARG0: President Donald Trump] has used national security to [V: justify] [ARG1: his tariffs against Canada] . But he admitted on Twitter he is doing it for another reason , opening the door for a lawsuit .

President Donald Trump has used national security to justify his tariffs against Canada . But [ARG0: he] [V: admitted] [ARGM-LOC: on Twitter] [ARG1: he is doing it for another reason , opening the door for a lawsuit] .
President Donald Trump has used national security to justify his tariffs against Canada . But he admitted on Twitter he [V: is] doing it for another reason , opening the door for a lawsuit .

President Donald Trump has used national security to justify his tariffs against Canada . But he admitted on Twitter [ARG0: he] is [V: doing] [ARG1: it] [ARGM-PRP: for another reason] , [ARGM-ADV: opening the door for a lawsuit] .

President Donald Trump has used national security to justify his tariffs against Canada . But [ARG0: he] admitted on Twitter he is doing it for another reason , [V: opening] [ARG1: the door for a lawsuit] .
